entry.title: SBI Crypto Sues Riot Blockchain-Owned Data Center for Fraud, Negligence
entry.summary: SBI Crypto alleges that Riot-owned data center Whinstone fraudulently misrepresented its capacity to host large-scale mining operations.

entry.title: North Korea's ‘Malicious Cyber Activities’ Deeply Concerning, Say US, Japan, South Korea: Report
entry.summary: High-level diplomats have urged the global community to ensure the repatriation of all North Korean nationals working abroad.

entry.title: Which Crypto Transactions Are NOT Taxable? How To Minimize Your Crypto Taxes
entry.summary: Doing your crypto taxes can be a lot less stressful if you know how to minimize your tax burden.

entry.title: Web3 YouTuber CryptoStache: Gaming Will Be the Catalyst That Takes NFTs Mainstream
entry.summary: Web3 gaming YouTuber CryptoStache talks to Decrypt's Jason Nelson at Outer Edge LA about why Web3 gaming will bring NFTs mainstream, the partnerships that prove it's already happening, how gamers will change their tune on NFTs, and how the terminology is likely to change.

entry.title: Fordefi Aims to Dramatically Simplify the Institutional Crypto Wallet
entry.summary: Steve H., VP of sales from Fordefi, which raised $18 million in funding last year, tells Decrypt's Jason Nelson at Outer Edge LA how Fordefi uses multi-party computation to make signing transactions on an institutional crypto wallet much simpler—no seed phrase needed.

entry.title: Unreleased David Bowie Recording to Debut as Music NFT
entry.summary: The never-before-heard version of Bowie's hit "Let’s Dance" will be sold via pay-what-you-want NFTs from Gala Music and benefit charity.

entry.title: Meta Launches AI Tool That Can Identify, Separate Items in Pictures
entry.summary: Meta unveils "Segment Anything" AI image identification tool, but the scale of the dataset used by the social giant raises privacy concerns.

entry.title: Dogecoin Drops Sharply After Twitter Blue Bird Returns
entry.summary: Doge had a very short run as Twitter's new mascot.

entry.title: gm: Canadian Bitcoin Miner Hut 8 Is Heading West
entry.summary: Toronto-based Bitcoin mining company Hut 8 recently announced a merger with U.S. Bitcoin Corp that will take it into Texas, Nebraska, and New York. Hut 8 CEO Jaime Leverton joined Dan Roberts and Stacy Elliott to talk expanding into the U.S., dealing with regulatory pushback post-FTX, why Texas is such a hotspot, and where she'd like to expand globally down the road (the climates may surprise you). Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: ChatGPT Picks Gold Over Bitcoin, Says Crypto Critic Peter Schiff
entry.summary: ChatGPT chooses to include gold, not Bitcoin, as part of its "recession-proof" portfolio.

entry.title: Lawyer Says He’s Called the FBI on Bitboy Over Threatening Emails, Calls and Tweets
entry.summary: After weeks of threatening messages, lawyer Adam Moskowitz says he fears that one of Bitboy’s followers might try to harm him and his family.

entry.title: Treasury Says Crooks Prefer Fiat to Crypto in DeFi Risk Report
entry.summary: The Treasury Department said in a Thursday report that criminals do indeed use DeFi tools and apps, but most criminal activity still opts for fiat.

entry.title: Lawyers Claim Shaq Is Hiding From FTX Lawsuit, Seek Alternative Method to Serve Him
entry.summary: Shaquille O'Neal is a defendant in a lawsuit for promoting FTX, including Tom Brady and Larry David.

entry.title: Apple's Hidden Bitcoin White Paper the Latest in a Long List of Easter Eggs
entry.summary: The seminal document behind Bitcoin has been lurking in an innocuous file on Apple computers for years. Here's how to find it.

entry.title: Magic Eden Bitcoin NFT Launchpad Debuts as Ordinals Total Nears 1 Million
entry.summary: Interest in Ordinals is going strong, and now NFT marketplace Magic Eden looks to further capitalize on the latest Bitcoin craze.

entry.title: Aragon’s New DAO Toolkit on Polygon Takes Aim at Voter Apathy
entry.summary: Aragon’s recently launched tech stack is now live on Polygon, dropping costs for spinning up DAOs and taking aim at voter apathy.

entry.title: Mutant Apes Take the Lead in Serum City, an ApeCoin-Powered Ethereum NFT Game
entry.summary: Novel Labs and Faraway are developing an independent city-building game that gives new life to Yuga Labs’ Mutant Ape Yacht Club NFTs.

entry.title: Dogecoin Down 8% as Musk’s Twitter Hype Fades
entry.summary: Dogecoin has posted an intraday loss of roughly 8%, but it still has most of its Elon Musk-assisted gains over the last seven days.

entry.title: North Carolina County Mulls 1-Year Bitcoin Mining Moratorium
entry.summary: The 1-year moratorium on mining would give county officials more time to better establish clearer standards for the activity.

entry.title: Australia Financial Regulator Cancels Binance Derivatives Business License
entry.summary: Binance requested the cancellation a day before Australia's securities regulator announced that it would end the license.

entry.title: Report Blasts Bitcoin Mining for Pollution—But Bitcoiners Aren’t Buying It
entry.summary: The Environmental Working Group continues to rail against proof-of-work blockchains.

entry.title: Has Amazon Lost The AI Race?
entry.summary: Despite flagging demand for Alexa, experts say Amazon could still pull ahead of the pack.

entry.title: ‘Bitcoin Stamps’ NFTs Are Gaining On Ordinals
entry.summary: The creator of the new protocol claims it is the “most permanent” means of inscribing data on the Bitcoin blockchain.

entry.title: AI Fears Grow as Germany, France, Sweden, and Canada Voice Concerns
entry.summary: In the wake of an outright ban of ChatGPT in Italy, governments are trying to balance innovation with protecting user privacy.

entry.title: Is Texas Still 'Very Open for Business' for Bitcoin Mining?
entry.summary: The state is a mining hot-spot, but a new bill limiting benefits got unanimous approval by a state Senate committee. Mining advocates are concerned.

entry.title: Future of Paxful Bitcoin Exchange in Flux As Co-Founders Fight
entry.summary: One wants to resume operation of the marketplace, the other is directing users to an alternative service.

entry.title: MobileCoin Exec Bob Lee Fatally Stabbed in San Francisco
entry.summary: The Cash App creator also led Google's Android team and helped combat the COVID-19 pandemic.

entry.title: Meta Reveals AI Tool to Help Brands Target Facebook, Instagram Users
entry.summary: Meta’s recent embrace of AI is only growing, with new plans for generative ads—and Meta’s CTO thinks AI will help power the metaverse, too.

entry.title: MicroStrategy Buys More Bitcoin as Asset Nears Company’s Break Even Price
entry.summary: The software company is still buying up the cryptocurrency—which has soared in value since January.

entry.title: 'Lollipop' NFT Racing Game From Filmmaker David Ayer Coming to Polygon
entry.summary: Feature.io tapped “The Fast and Furious” co-writer Ayer to write and produce the project, which is billed as an interactive media experience.

entry.title: 'District 9' Director Is Launching a Web3 Game—With a Dedicated Avalanche Subnet
entry.summary: Developer Gunzilla Games and Neill Blomkamp will roll out the upcoming battle royale shooter via an Avalanche subnet.

entry.title: Batteries or Bitcoin: Is Mining the Best Use for ‘Excess’ Green Energy?
entry.summary: Bitcoin miners are quick to claim they're an asset to grids, while others suggest it’s not the best use of excess green energy. Which is it?

entry.title: CoinFLEX Founder Offers Bitcoin Evangelist Roger Ver ‘Olive Branch’ to Settle Alleged $84M Debt
entry.summary: The CoinFLEX founder offered Ver and Blockchain.com’s CEO two years of free trading on OPNX should they settle their debts.

entry.title: Swiss Bank PostFinance to Roll Out Bitcoin, Ethereum Services for Clients
entry.summary: PostFinance is rolling out a range of crypto services through a new partnership with digital assets bank Sygnum.

entry.title: Ethereum, LSD Tokens on the Rise Ahead of Next Week's Shanghai Upgrade
entry.summary: With Ethereum’s next upgrade just around the corner, ETH and tokens powering liquid staking platforms are soaring.

entry.title: Tron Launches Dominica Metaverse Bound Token With Huobi
entry.summary: The digital identity system lays the foundation for a metaverse “truly capable of servicing the global population.”

entry.title: What Is Ethereum’s Shanghai Upgrade?
entry.summary: The Shanghai fork will implement EIP-4895, which allows validators to withdraw ETH that have been staked since as long ago as December 2020.

entry.title: Ultra’s New Web3 Gaming Marketplace Lets Users Resell Digital Games
entry.summary: Gone are the days of digital games rotting in your Steam library—Ultra Games will let you sell them to other users.

entry.title: Ethereum’s ERC-4337 Standard: A Game-Changing, User-Friendly Innovation
entry.summary: The ERC-4337 standard enhances the functionality and user friendliness of Ethereum without requiring a change to the core blockchain protocol.

entry.title: Free POAP? Not for Commercial Users of the Ethereum Attendance NFTs
entry.summary: The "proof of attendance" badge provider says it will still waive fees for some projects.

entry.title: ‘Criminal’ Trump NFTs Rise as Former President Faces 34 Felony Charges
entry.summary: Trump's own NFT trading cards are up—but so are these unauthorized knockoffs that show the former U.S. president locked up in prison.

entry.title: NFT Sales Near $2 Billion in March as Blur Dominates Market
entry.summary: March trading volume dips only slightly compared to February, but 69% of it came from a single marketplace.

entry.title: Latin America’s Biggest Investment Bank Just Launched a Stablecoin on Polygon
entry.summary: Brazil-based BTG Pactual today launched its BTG Dol stablecoin, a dollar-backed asset.

entry.title: gm: Kevin Owocki Wants to Regenerate DeFi
entry.summary: Move over, DeFi—ReFi is coming? Gitcoin founder Kevin Owocki has stepped away from DeFi grant-giving machine Gitcoin as it fully decentralizes and is now focused on regenerative finance (huh?) and ReFi incubator Supermodular. He aims to "regenerate the regenerators." He explained it all to Dan Roberts and Liam Kelly, and also talks DAO structure, crypto factions, NFT use cases, his book "Greenpilled," and much more. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: Why Aurory's Head of Production Left Ubisoft for Web3
entry.summary: Aurory executive producer and head of production Jonathan Campeau tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin at GDC about how the first-generation of Web3 games came out of DeFi and are now evolving.

entry.title: 'We Don't Really Do the Corporate Thing Very Well' Says Jason Brink on Gala Games Approach
entry.summary: With roughly 50 video games in its pipeline, Gala Games is all-in on Web3. Gala's President of Blockchain Jason Brink told Decrypt's Kate Irwin at GDC about the studio's ethos and weighs in on the different approaches to Web3 gaming.

entry.title: gm: Coinbase's Top Lawyer Gets Real on SEC
entry.summary: Paul Grewal is the Chief Legal Officer at Coinbase and a former U.S. magistrate judge in Northern California. He gave Dan Roberts and Stacy Elliott his candid takes on Sam Bankman-Fried and FTX, the SEC's crackdown on staking, the sanctioning of Tornado Cash, and more alpha on how Coinbase is approaching the current unfriendly US regulatory environment. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: The Founder of Rotten Tomatoes Says Web3 Entertainment Isn’t Nearly Entertaining Enough Yet
entry.summary: Rotten Tomatoes founder Patrick Lee, who has led companies at the intersection of technology and entertainment from Web1 to Web3, spoke to Decrypt's Sander Lutz at Outer Edge LA about the current state of decentralized gaming, film and television.

entry.title: gm: How Gnosis Has Endured and Evolved
entry.summary: Gnosis first launched in 2015 as a decentralized prediction market built on Ethereum. Now it's a DAO, a multi-sig wallet, a staking chain, and a vibrant community with its own GNO governance token. Co-founder and COO Friederike Ernst talked to Dan Roberts and Stacy Elliott about the careful evolution of Gnosis, decentralization impostors, account abstraction, DeFi UX failures, why Ethereum is the "Manhattan of crypto," and much more. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: Justin Aversano's Inspiration for Tarot-Themed NFT Photo Series 'Smoke and Mirrors'
entry.summary: Justin Aversano, best known for his high-selling "Twin Flames" NFT photo series, joined Decrypt’s Andrew Hayward ahead of the upcoming L.A. exhibition for his new Ethereum NFT project "Smoke and Mirrors." He shared the wild inspiration behind the tarot-themed collection, and why—despite his growing profile—he opted not to exhibit at a major brand-name gallery.

entry.title: Midnight Society’s Rob Bowling Talks Deadrop Launch and Working With Dr. Disrespect
entry.summary: Former "Call of Duty" developer Rob Bowling, now head of Midnight Society Studio, checked in with Decrypt's Kate Irwin at GDC and shared some behind-the-scenes statistics on how players are enjoying "Deadrop." The game saw 90,000 player hours over the weekend, with 97 minutes average play time per player, and their community size tripled in just a few days.

entry.title: Big Brands Get Serious About NFTs: Salesforce, VW, Panerai, Absolute Labs at NFT Paris
entry.summary: On this panel from NFT Paris 2023 moderated by Decrypt's Dan Roberts, Web3 leads from some of the largest consumer and tech brands discuss their NFT strategies. Marc Mathieu of Salesforce, Tim Walther of VW Group, Eva Assayag of Panerai, and Samir Addamine of Absolute Labs joined the panel.

entry.title: NFT Entertainment Revolution: Warner Bros, Orange Comet, CyberBrokers and NFT Now at NFT Paris
entry.summary: At NFT Paris 2023, Decrypt’s Stephen Graves moderated a discussion about NFTs and the entertainment industry with Warner Bros’ NFT head Josh Hackbarth, CyberBrokers founder Josie Bellini, NFT Now founder Matt Medved and Dave Broome, CEO of Orange Comet, which has produced NFTs for Anthony Hopkins and The Walking Dead.

entry.title: Step Inside the Armory of the NFT Collective 'Knights Who Say Nah'
entry.summary: Knights Who Say Nah co-founder and project lead Nick Richey chats with Decrypt's Jason Nelson inside the group's armory of artifacts, shows off a historic Japanese tanto sword, and discusses why the preservation of historical artifacts is the best use case for NFTs.

entry.title: Voltz Labs CEO: DeFi Innovation Is Moving Offshore Because of US Regulatory Severity
entry.summary: Voltz Labs Co-founder and CEO Simon Jones talks to Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about using DeFi for interest rate swaps, the unfriendly regulatory environment in the US right now, emerging economies becoming crypto hubs, and the "cartoonishly large" market opportunity for DeFi.

entry.title: MoonPay CEO: Next Phase of NFT Adoption Will Come From 'Brands You Love in Your Everyday Life'
entry.summary: MoonPay CEO Ivan Soto-Wright talked to Decrypt's Liam Kelly at NFT Paris about how NFTs are clearly not "waning," how MoonPay works with brands like Puma and Nike to manage their Web3 plays and smart contracts, and how NFTs and crypto will go mainstream when they can integrate in our daily lives—and his prediction that brands will drive that.
